div1.p: Carter requests books from the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to G.W. McCoy, March 3, 1925
div1.opener:
bur
Book
Library
LIBRARY
HYGIENIC LABORATORY
WASHINGTON, D. C.
MAR 7 - 1925
/LC
Hygienic Laboratory
RECEIVED
MAR - 5 1925
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
March 3, 1925.
Dear Doctor McCoy:
div1.p:
I would be very grateful if, in addition to the books I already
have and which are not yet ready to be returned, you could get me,
from the Library of Congress:
1/ Herrera y Tordesillas, Antonio de
Los Hechos de los Castillanos en las Islas y Tierra Firme
del Mar Oceano.
Vols. 1 & 2.
2/ Oviedo y Valdez, Gonzalo Fernandez de
Historia General y Natural de las Indias etc.
Vol. 2.

With very best remembrances to you and yours in which Laura, who
is writing this, joins
div1.closer:
Sincerely your friend, H. R. Carter Surgeon G. W. McCoy, Director,
Hygienic Laboratory,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
Twenty-fifth & E Sts. N. W.
